comments:
Using RC1 and a site built built in a site project.

Upon clicking "Install" on the "Jar Verification" page, I get a dialog with 
this error:

Unable to complete action for feature "Spindle 3, an Eclipse Plugin for 
Tapestry" due to errors.
  The File "C:\DOCUME~1\ADMINI~1\LOCALS~1\Temp\eclipse\.update\1086805429968
\1086805429974\eclipse63145.tmp" is not a valid JAR file. [error in opening zip 
file]

Not sure what this means, but all the jars in the site were built using 
the "Build All" button on the "Features" page of the site manifest editor.

On further inspection of the folder referenced in the error message I find that 
it contains stuff from the feature jar:

feature.xml
spindle.gif

and *two* temp files:

eclipse63144.tmp <- looks like the feature jar renamed. checked with winzip

eclipse63145.tmp <- 1 kb file that winzip opens as empty. This is the file 
referred to in the error.

found a stack trace:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[0]: java.util.zip.ZipException: error in 
opening zip file
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.security.JarVerifier.init
(JarVerifier.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.security.JarVerifier.verify
(JarVerifier.java:229)
	at org.eclipse.update.core.Feature.verifyReferences(Feature.java:933)
	at org.eclipse.update.core.Feature.install(Feature.java:353)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.SiteFile.install(SiteFile.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.ConfiguredSite.install
(ConfiguredSite.java:121)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.ConfiguredSite.install
(ConfiguredSite.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.operations.InstallOperation.execute
(InstallOperation.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.operations.BatchInstallOperation.execute
(BatchInstallOperation.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard$1.run
(InstallWizard.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:101)

Can you verify that all the features and plugins were correctly built?
Is it possible to attach a simple, small test case here?

The feature archive looks correctly built. Looking at the 5 plugins in the 
feature....they are fine.

A test case is possible, but not this afternoon - I'm heading out to pick up my 
kid.

Yes, when downloading, jars get renamed to some temp file (I think this is a 
bit wrong, as it is sufficient to just have temp names for parent folder, but 
keep the features with their original name; this could also be reused later).

What JDK are you using? Are you using the same JDK for both building features 
and installing ?

java.runtime.name=Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition
java.runtime.version=1.4.2_04-b05

for both the build and the install.

I'll post anymore findings thursday. cheers.

I rebuilt the site and now I can't reproduce the problem . Also made a small 
new site, feature, and 3 plugin projects all containing contents produced by 
the wizards. Not seeing this behaviour with that site either.

Will keep trying.

This looks like some corrupted zip in the first site build.
I will close this bug, but please-reopen and attach a simple test case if you 
still notice the reported problem.
